Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ensemble \En`sem"ble\, n. [F.] The whole; all the parts taken together. [1913 Webster] ||

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ensemble \En`sem"ble\, adv. [F.] All at once; together. [1913 Webster]

ensemble n 1: a group of musicians playing or singing together; "a string ensemble" 2: a cast other than the principles [syn: {supporting players}] 3: the chorus of a ballet company [syn: {corps de ballet}] 4: an assemblage of parts or details (as in a work of art) considered as forming a whole [syn: {tout ensemble}] 5: a coordinated outfit (set of clothing)
